newsitem.title: USA: Maryland says Feb. unemployment steady at 4.9 pct.
newsitem.headline: Maryland says Feb. unemployment steady at 4.9 pct.

text.p: Maryland's job market was little changed in February, leaving the unemployment rate unchanged from January's 4.9 percent level, the state's Department of Labor, Licensing and Regulation said.
"Although the state's unemployment rate remained the same in February, it is more than half a percentage point lower than a year ago," Gov. Parris Glendening said in a statement.

Local unemployment rates were as low as 2.4 percent in Montgomery County and 2.7 percent in Howard County. Unemployment rose slightly in the Baltimore metropolitan area, to 5.3 percent from 5.2 percent.
The employment number rose to a record high in the month at 2.579 million. The number of unemployed rose to 134,489.
Maryland's March employment figures are not yet available.
